item.title: Ancient Greek and Roman statues often smelled like roses, a new study says - NPR
item.description:
1. Ancient Greek and Roman statues often smelled like roses, a new study says  NPR
  2. Ancient Sculptures Didn’t Just Look Good—They Also Smelled Heavenly, Study Finds  artnet News
  3. Statues in ancient Greece, Rome were colorful — and perfumed  DW (English)
  4. Ancient Greek and Roman Statues Were Not Only Beautiful, but Also Smelled Nice, Too  Smithsonian Magazine
  5. The Scent of Veneration: Study shows Ancient Statues were Perfumed  The Wild Hunt
